title: Ryze skill order (E first?)
body:
First off, Ryze is OP and should be permabanned and nerfed significantly. Until then, I'm going to 100-0 burst someone with one spell cast. 

Why does no one max E first (or at least put points into it early) on the reworked Ryze? A lot of the time, its the emphasis on the W max... Which is understandable for the increased CC that it brings (and perma snare with his passive). Even before his W gets nerfed later, however, I feel E max is more viable (unless the additional CC is absolutely necessary), partially because when you're in lane, you don't have the mana to make the most of your passive (spamming spells will OOM you in about 2 passive rotation spams), meaning your W will get less use overall, and you have increased trading and kill potential with your E. For example, all Ryze has to do in lane is Q the minions to stack up a tear, and immediately cast E once the enemy champion positions themselves poorly (in the minion wave), which bounces 3-6 times (depending on how many minions nearby) and deals 2-4x the normal damage, enough to win any normal trade. In solo scenarios, the E is much more effective at harassing the enemy. In most scenarios, your enemy also won't trade with you when your passive is up or near up (if they're playing reasonably), so sneaking in a high damage E nuke is a lot easier. 

The final kicker is what happens when you use your ult + E. This isn't even making use of the passive, but at level 6 with a rank 3 E and no significant items, you already deal an ideal 700 or so damage with one ulted E cast that bounces to the minion wave. The AoE on the first cast is the same as the bounce radius, so if it bounces 6 times, you deal 1 base damage + 6 half base damage (since it does full base damage to the secondary target, halved for the AoE) + 6 half base damage (returning orbs) to the PRIMARY target, totalling to a whopping 7x the normal base damage, or 574 + 210% AP + 14% maximum mana, or about 700 damage with starter items only when people only have 1k hp at level 6. Even in non-ideal situations, the E max route, combined with the ult, can chunk people down to about half HP, bouncing to only 4 minions. In teamfights, the MR shred and devastating AoE is a much more valuable contribution than a Q max, and situationally better than a W max. You also cast E as your second most common ability, so maxing it benefits your DPS, and with your ult up, your E does substantially more damage than multiple Q casts. 

TLDR: E + Ult = BOOM. W + Passive = OOM. Maybe W has some secret use of which I'm not aware... but permasnaring isn't useful until you actually have the mana to do it.

replies.body: I just rolled a 6 sided die and randomly voted on E and there isn't many votes on this, 8 since this message was posted.
E max will be more viable as soon as the nerf hit's live, fact is a perma snare is better then more damage.
You dont stand in minions to dodge e, you stand in minions to dodge q and away from minions to avoid e. (Used to max q first, now its W LOL)

They are nerfing W and Passive, buffing Q and changing how Q interacts with is passive to make people max Q first again.

You use perma-snare during ganks or when people get caught under tower.

Ryze's early damage with E max is really strong, HOWEVER if your opponent knows not to stand in the minion wave to avoid bounces, a lot of your E max damage is negated.
